Detailed Description

Documentation of player proxy related types.

When a player proxy (PP) interacts with RemLib it does this (amongst others) with callback functions and PP specific data types. They are decribed on this page. You probably don't want to read this page from top to bottom but come here when these callback functions and data type get mentioned in the Server Interface documentation.

Typedef Documentation

typedef RemLibrary*(* RemPPGetLibraryFunc)(RemPPPriv *pp_priv)

RemLib requests the PLIDs and names of a media player's ploblists.

Parameters:
[in] pp_priv the PP's private data
Returns:
a RemLibrarylisting all available ploblists

typedef RemPlob*(* RemPPGetPlobFunc)(RemPPPriv *pp_priv, const gchar *pid)

RemLib requests a RemPlob with a certain PID.

Parameters:
[in] pp_priv the PP's private data
[in] pid the PID of the requested RemPlob
Returns:
the requested RemPlob (must not be NULL -if there is no information about the requested plob, return a dummy plob or something like that - see rem_plob_new_unknown())

typedef RemStringList*(* RemPPGetPloblistFunc)(RemPPPriv *pp_priv, const gchar *plid)

RemLib requests the PIDs of the plobs in a certain ploblist.

Parameters:
[in] pp_priv the PP's private data
[in] pid the PLID of the ploblist
Returns:
a list of the PIDs of the plobs in the specified ploblist

typedef void(* RemPPNotifyErrorFunc)(RemPPPriv *pp_priv, GError *err)

RemLib notifies that a crucial error occured.

As a result the PP should call rem_server_down().

Parameters:
[in] pp_priv the PP's private data
[in] err a GError describing the occured error (you are responsible for freeing this error!)

typedef void(* RemPPPlayPloblistFunc)(RemPPPriv *pp_priv, const gchar *plid)

RemLib requests the PP to use (the contents of) the ploblist as the new playlist.

Parameters:
[in] pp_priv the PP's private data
[in] plid the PLID of the ploblist to play
Remarks:
If a media player has a global playlist, this means clearing the playlist and putting the contents of the ploblist plid into the global playlist. If a media player has no global playlist, this means switching to the ploblist plid.

typedef struct _RemPPPriv RemPPPriv

The RemPPPriv struct is (for RemLib) an opaque data structure to store player proxy private data.

Player proxies may define struct _RemPPPriv according to their needs.

See also:
rem_server_up()

typedef RemStringList*(* RemPPSearchFunc)(RemPPPriv *pp_priv, const RemPlob *mask)

RemLib requests the PIDs of the plobs that equal in the meta information elements set in mask.

Parameters:
[in] pp_priv the PP's private data
[in] mask a RemPlob to use as the mask for the search
Returns:
a list of the PIDs of the plobs that match mask
Remarks:
This is a future feature (currently not implemented on client side - as of client version 0.6.0). So you do not need to bother with that at the moment. You cannot test it anyway.

typedef void(* RemPPSimpleControlFunc)(RemPPPriv *pp_priv, RemSimpleControlCommand cmd, gint param)

RemLib requests the PP to do the simple control command command with the parameter param.

See RemSimpleControlCommand for what the individual commands and possible parameters mean.

Parameters:
[in] pp_priv the PP's private data
[in] cmd the command to do
[in] param a parameter for command

typedef void(* RemPPSynchronizeFunc)(RemPPPriv *pp_priv, RemPlayerStatus *status)

RemLib requests the PP to synchronize status to the current player status.

Parameters:
[in] pp_priv the PP's private data
[out] status the RemPlayerStatus to synchronize
Remarks:
Do not make any assumptions about the values in status.

typedef void(* RemPPUpdatePlobFunc)(RemPPPriv *pp_priv, const RemPlob *plob)

RemLib requests the PP to update (on player side) the meta information of a plob.

Parameters:
[in] pp_priv the PP's private data
[in] plob the plob with the new meta information (which has been set on a client)

typedef void(* RemPPUpdatePloblistFunc)(RemPPPriv *pp_priv, const gchar *plid, const RemStringList *pids)

RemLib requests the PP to update (on player side) the contents of a ploblist.

Parameters:
[in] pp_priv the PP's private data
[in] plid the PLID of the ploblist to update
[in] pids a list of PIDs of plobs that make up the new ploblist
Remarks:
This is a future feature (currently not implemented on client side - as of client version 0.6.0). So you do not need to bother with that at the moment. You cannot test it anyway.
